text:
Argentan is a French city in the Orne department, in Lower Normandy. 17 327 people live there. The size is. The river Orne flows through Argentan. The forests of Gouffern and Ecouves are nearby.
Argentan was built at the beginning of the 12th century by Henry II. Henry was a Normandy duke and also the king of England.
There are three churches: Saint Martin, Saint Germain and Saint Michel.
